hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "On the first night of the month of Ramadan, the Shayatin are shackled, the jinns are restrained, the gates of the Fires are shut such that no gate among them would be opened. The gates of Paradise are opened such that no gate among them would be closed, and a caller calls: 'O seeker of the good; come near!' and 'O seeker of evil; stop! For there are those whom Allah frees from the Fire.' And that is every night."
question: What happens to the Shayatin and jinns during the month of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever fasts Ramadan and stands (in the night prayer) for it out of faith and seeking a reward (from Allah), he will be forgiven what preceded of his sins. Whoever stands (in the night prayer) on the Night of Al-Qadr out of faith and seeking a reward (from Allah), he will be forgiven what preceded of his sins."
question: What are the spiritual benefits of fasting during Ramadan according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Do not precede the month with a day nor with two days, unless that fast falls on a day that one of you would have (normally) fasted. Fast with its sighting and break fast with its sighting, and if it is cloudy, then count for thirty days, and then break (the fast)."
question: What is the significance of not preceding the month with fasting before its sighting?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Do no precede the month of Ramadan by fasting a day or two before it, unless it is the case of a man who normally performs some fast, then let him fast it."
question: What is the ruling on fasting immediately before the month of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "We were with Ammar bin Yasir when a roasted sheep was brought and he said: 'Eat.' Someone among the people said: 'I am fasting.' So Ammar said: 'Whoever fasts on a day in which there is doubt, then he has disobeyed Abul-Qasim (pbuh)."
question: What is the significance of avoiding fasting on days of doubt in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Count the (the appearances of) the crescent of Sha'ban for Ramadan."
question: What is the significance of observing the crescent moon in Islamic months?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Do not fast before Ramadan. Fast with its sighting, and break fast with its sighting, and if it is obscured from you, then complete thirty days."
question: What is the significance of sighting the moon in determining the start and end of Ramadan?

hadith-eng:
"What I fasted with the Prophet that was twenty-nine (days), was more than what we fasted that was thirty."
(He said): There are narrations on this topic from `Umar, Abu Hurairah, `A'isha, Sa`d bin Abi Waqqas, Ibn `Abbas, Ibn `Umar, Anas, Jabir, Umm Salamah, Abu Bakrah, that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The month is twenty nine (days)."
question: What is the significance of the lunar calendar in determining the length of a month in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah vowed to stay away from his wives for a month, so he stayed in a loft for twenty-nine days. They said: 'O Messenger of Allah, your vow was for a month,' so he said: 'The month is twenty-nine (days).'"
question: What is the significance of the Prophet's vow to stay away from his wives for a month?

hadith-eng: "A Bedouin came to the Prophet and said: 'I have seen the crescent.' So he said: 'Do you testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah? Do you testify that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'Yes.' So he said: 'O Bilal! Announce to the people that they should fast tomorrow.'"
question: What is the significance of witnessing the crescent moon in determining the start of fasting in Islam?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "The two months of Eid will not both be deficient: Ramadn and Dhul-Hijjah."
question: What is the significance of the two months of Eid in Islam?

hadith-eng: "Kuraib informed me that Umm Al-Fadl bin Al-Harith sent him to Mu'awiyah in Ash-Sham. He said: 'So I arrived in Ash-Sham and finished her errand, and I saw the crescent of Ramadan while I was in Ash-Sham. We saw the crescent on the night of Friday. Then I arrived in Al-Madinah at the end of the month. Ibn Abbas was questioning me, then he mentioned the crescent and he said: "When did you see the crescent?" I said: "We saw it n the night of Friday." He said: "Did you see it on the night of Friday?" I said: "The people saw it, so they fasted, and Mu'awiyah fasted." He said: "But we saw it on the night of Saturday, so we will not stop fasting until we complete thirty days or we see it." So I said: "Is not the sighting and fasting of Mu'awiyah enough for you?" He said: "This is not how the Messenger of Allah ordered us."
question: What is the significance of local moon sighting in determining the start of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever has dried dates, then let him break the fast with that, and whoever does not, then let him break the fast with water, for indeed water is purifying."
question: What are the recommended foods or drinks to break a fast in Islam?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "When one of you breaks his fast, then let him do so with dried dates. And whoever does not find dates, then water, for it is purifying."
question: What is the recommended food to break a fast with according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would break the fast with fresh dates before performing Salat. If there were no fresh dates then (he would break the fast) with dried dates, and if there were no dried dates then he would take a few sips of water."
question: What is the significance of breaking the fast with fresh dates in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "The fast is the day the people fast, the breaking of the fast is the day the people break their fast, and the sacrifice is the day the people sacrifice."
question: What is the significance of communal observance in fasting and breaking the fast in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "When the night advances and the day retreats, and the sun is hidden, then the fast is to be broken."
question: What are the signs that indicate the time to break the fast during Ramadan?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "The people will remain upon goodness as long as they hasten to break the fast."
question: What is the significance of hastening to break the fast in Islam?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Allah, Mighty and Sublime is He, said: 'Those of My worshippers who are most beloved to me are the quickest to break their fast.'"
question: Who are considered the most beloved worshippers to Allah according to this saying?

hadith-eng: (A Hadith similar to no. 700 with a different chain).
question: What is the significance of Abu Hurairah as a narrator in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "Masruq and I entered upon Aishah and we said: 'O Mother of the Believers! There are two men from the Companions of Muhammad, one of them hastens to break the fasts and he hastens to perform Salat. The other delays breaking the fast and he delays the Salat.' She said: 'Which of them hastens to break the fast and hastens to perform the Salat?' We said that it was Abdullah bin Mas'ud. She said: 'This is how the Messenger of Allah did it.' And the other was Abu Musa."
question: What is the significance of hastening to break the fast in Islamic practice?

hadith-eng: Zaid bin Thabit said: "We ate Sahar with the Messenger of Allah, then we stood for the Salat." I (Anas) said: "How long was that?" He said: "About the lengthy of fifty Ayahs."
question: What is the significance of the pre-dawn meal (Sahar) in Islamic practice?

hadith-eng: (Another chain) except that he said: "About the length for reciting fifty Ayahs."
question: What is the significance of the length of time it takes to recite fifty Ayahs in Islamic practice?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Eat and drink, and do not be disturbed by the rising glow, eat and drink until the redness appears to you on the horizon."
question: What guidance is provided regarding the timing of eating and drinking during fasting?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Do not let the Adhan of Bilal prevent you from your Sahar, nor the drawn out Fajr, but the Fajr that spreads on the horizon."
question: What is the significance of the Adhan of Bilal in relation to the pre-dawn meal during Ramadan?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Whoever does not leave false speech, and acting according to it, then Allah is not in any need of him leaving his food and his drink."
question: What is the significance of abandoning false speech during fasting in Islam?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Partake of Sahar, for indeed there is a blessing in the Sahar."
question: What is the significance of consuming Sahar in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: (similar to no. 708) from the Prophet.
question: What is the significance of Amr bin Al-As as a narrator in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah went to Makkah in the Year of the Conquest, so he fasted until he reached Kura Al-Ghamim and the people were fasting with him. Then it was said to him: 'The fast has become difficult for the people, and they are watching you to see what you will do.' So after Asr, he called for a cup of water and drank it while the people were looking at him. Some of them broke the fast while some of them continued their fasting. It was conveyed to him that people were still fasting, so he said: "Those are the disobedient.'"
question: What actions did the Prophet take when he realized fasting had become difficult for the people during the journey?

hadith-eng: Hamzah bin Amr Al-Aslami asked the Messenger of Allah about fasting while traveling, and he fasted regularly. So the Messenger of Allah said: 'If you wish then fast, and if you wish then break (the fast).'"
question: What is the ruling on fasting while traveling in Islam?

hadith-eng: "We were on a journey with the Messenger of Allah during the month of Ramadan. No one objected to the fast of the one fasting nor the fast breaking of the one who broke his fast."
question: What is the significance of mutual respect for individual choices regarding fasting during a journey?

hadith-eng: "We were on a journey with the Messenger of Allah. Some of us were fasting and some of us broke their fast. The one who broke their fast had no objection to the one who fasted, and the one who fasted had no objection to the one who broke his fast. They saw that whoever had the strength to fast then that was good, and whoever was weak, then breaking it was better."
question: What is the significance of mutual respect and understanding among Muslims regarding fasting during a journey?

hadith-eng: he asked Ibn Al-Musaiyab about fasting on a journey, so he narrated to him that Umar bin Al-Khattab said: "We fought in two battles along with the Messenger of Allah during Ramadan; the Day of Badr, and the Conquest (of Makkah), so we broke our fast during them."
question: What is the ruling on fasting during travel in Islam?

hadith-eng: "Some cavalry man of the Messenger of Allah came galloping upon us, so I came to the Messenger of Allah and found him having lunch. He said: "Come and eat." I said: 'I am fasting.' So he said: 'Come and I will narrate to you about the fast - or fasting. Indeed Allah Most High lifted (the fast and) half of the Salat from the traveler, and (He lifted) the fast - or fasting - from the pregnant person, or the breast-feeding person.' And by Allah! The Prophet said both of them or one of them. So woe to me! For I did not eat from the meal of the Prophet."
question: What are the exemptions from fasting mentioned for travelers, pregnant, and breastfeeding individuals?

hadith-eng: "A woman came to the Prophet and said: 'My sister died while she had two consecutive months of fasting due.' So he said: 'Do you not see that if there was a debt due from your sister then you would have to pay it?' She said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Then the right of Allah is more appropriate.'"
question: What is the significance of fulfilling religious obligations on behalf of deceased family members?

hadith-eng: (A Hadith similar to no. 716 with a different chain.)
question: What is the significance of different chains of narration in understanding hadiths?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Whoever died while he had a month to fast, then a needy person should be fed on his behalf in place of every day."
question: What should be done if a person dies with missed fasts?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Three things do not break the fast of the fasting person: Cupping, vomiting, and the wet dream."
question: What are the actions that do not invalidate the fast according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Whoever is overcome by vomiting, then he is not required to make up (the fast), and whoever vomits on purpose, then he must make it up."
question: What is the ruling on fasting if a person vomits unintentionally?

hadith-eng: "Whoever eats or drinks forgetfully, then he has not broken (the fast), for it was only a provision that Allah provided for him."
question: What is the ruling on eating or drinking forgetfully while fasting in Islam?

hadith-eng: (Another chain) with the same or similar (Hadith as no. 721).
question: Who is the narrator of this hadith and what is its significance?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever breaks the fast during Ramadan without an allowance or illness, then if he fasted for all time, his fasting would not make up for it."
question: What are the consequences of breaking the fast during Ramadan without a valid reason?

hadith-eng: A man came and said: "O Messenger of Allah; I am ruined!" He said: "What has ruined you?" He said: "I had sexual relations with my wife during Ramadan." He said: "Are you able to free a slave?" He said, "No." He said: "Then are you able to fast for two consecutive months?" He said, "No." He said: "Then are you able to feed sixty needy people?" He said, "No." He said: "Sit." So he sat. A big basket full of dates was brought to the Prophet, and he said: "Give it in charity." So he said: "There is no one needier than us between its two mountains." So the Prophet laughing until his pre-molar teeth appeared, and he said: "Then take it to feed your family."
question: What are the consequences of having sexual relations during Ramadan fasting?

hadith-eng: "I saw the Prophet - (a number of times) such that I was not able to count - using the Siwak while he was fasting."
question: What is the significance of using the Siwak in Islam, especially during fasting?

hadith-eng: a man came to the Prophet and said: "My eyes are bothering me, can I use Kuhl while I am fasting?" He said: "Yes."
question: Is it permissible to use eye medication while fasting?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet would kiss during the month of fasting."
question: What actions are permissible between spouses during the month of fasting?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would fondle me while he was fasting, and he had the most control among you of his limb (li irbihi)."
question: What does this narration suggest about the self-control of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) during fasting?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would kiss and fondle while he was fasting, and he had the most control among you of his limbs."
question: What actions are permissible between spouses during fasting?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Whoever did not decide to fast before Fajr then there is no fast for him."
question: What is the significance of making an intention to fast before Fajr in Islam?

hadith-eng: "I was sitting with the Prophet when some drink was brought, so he drank from it, then he offered it to me and I drank it. Then I said: 'I have indeed sinned, so seek forgiveness for me.' He said: 'What is that?' I said: 'I was fasting, then I broke the fast.' He said: 'Were you performing a fast that you had to make up?' I said: 'No.' He said: 'Then it is no harm for you.'"
question: What is the ruling on breaking a voluntary fast in Islam?

hadith-eng: "A person from the offspring of Umm Hani narrated to me - I met one of the most virtuous among them, and his name was Ja'dah, and Umm Hani was his grandmother - he narrated to me from his grandmother that the Messenger of Allah entered upon her and asked for some drink, and he drank. Then he offered it to her and she drank it. Then she said: "O Messenger of Allah! I was fasting." So the Messenger of Allah said: "The one fasting a voluntary fast is the trustee for himself; if he wishes he fasts, and if he wishes he breaks." Shu'bah (one of the narrators) said: "I said to him (Ja'dah), 'Did you hear this from Umm Hani?' He said: 'No Abu Salih and our family informed us of it from Umm Hani.'"
question: What is the ruling on breaking a voluntary fast in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah visited me one day and said: 'Do you have anything (to eat)?'" She said: "I said: 'No.' He said: 'Then I am fasting.'"
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet's (ﷺ) approach to fasting when there is no food available?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah came to me saying, 'Do you have anything for breakfast?' I said: 'No.' Then he said: 'I am fasting.'" She said: "One day he came to me and I said: 'O Messenger of Allah; I have received a gift for us.' He said: 'What is it?'" She said: "I said 'Hais'  He said: 'I began the day fasting'" She said: "Then he ate."
question: What is the significance of flexibility in fasting according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "Hafsah and I were both fasting when we were presented some food that we really wanted, so we ate from it. The Messenger of Allah came, and Hafsah beat me to him - she was the daughter of her father - and she said: 'O Messenger of Allah! We were both fasting when we were presented with some food that we wanted, so we ate from it.' He said: 'Make up another day in its place.'"
question: What should one do if they break their fast unintentionally or due to temptation?

hadith-eng: "I did not see the Prophet fasting two consecutive months except for Sha'ban and Ramadan."
question: What is the significance of fasting during the months of Sha'ban and Ramadan in Islam?

hadith-eng: from the Prophet.
question: What is the significance of Aishah as a narrator in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "When a half of Sha'ban remains then do not fast."
question: What is the significance of the month of Sha'ban in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "I could not find the Messenger of Allah one night. So I left and found him at Al-Baqi. He said: 'Did you fear that you had been wronged by Allah and His Messenger?' I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I thought that you had gone to one of your wives.' So he said: 'Indeed Allah, Mighty and Sublime is He, descends to the lowest Heavens during the night of the middle of Sha'ban, to grant forgiveness to more than the number of hairs on the sheep of (Banu) Kalb.'"
question: What is the significance of the middle of Sha'ban in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "The most virtuous fasting after the month of Ramadan is Allah's month Al-Muharram."
question: Which month is considered the most virtuous for fasting after Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "A man asked Ali: "Which month do you order me to fast after the month of Ramadan?' He said to him, 'I have not heard anyone ask this except for a man whom I heard asking the Messenger of Allah while I was sitting with him. He said: "O Messenger of Allah! Which month do you order me to fast after the month of Ramadan?" He said: "If you will fast after the month of Ramadan, then fast Al-Muharram, for indeed it is Allah's month in which there is a day that Allah accepted the repentance of a people, and in which He accepts the repentance of other people."
question: Which month is recommended for fasting after Ramadan according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would fasting during the beginning of every month for three days, and Friday was the least of the days that he did not fast."
question: What is the significance of fasting at the beginning of each month in Islam?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "None of you should fast on Friday unless he fasts before it, or he fasts after it."
question: What is the significance of fasting on specific days in Islam?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Do not fast on Saturday except for what has been made obligatory upon you (by Allah). If one of you does not find but a grape peal or a tree's twig, then let him chew it."
question: What is the significance of not fasting on Saturday in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet used to try to fast on Mondays and Thursdays."
question: What days did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) prefer for fasting during the week?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would fast Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays in one months, and Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays in the next month."
question: What days of the week did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) choose to fast in different months?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Deeds are presented on Monday and Thursday, and I love that my deeds be presented while I am fasting."
question: On which days are deeds presented to Allah according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "I asked - or; the Prophet was asked - about fasting daily. So he said: 'Your family has a right over you.' Then he said: 'Fast Ramadan and that which is after it, and every Wednesday and Thursday. If you do that, then you will have fasted daily, as well as broken (the fast).'"
question: What is the significance of balancing religious practices with family rights in Islam?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Fast the Day of Arafah, for indeed I anticipate that Allah will forgive (the sins) of the year after it, and the year before it."
question: What is the significance of fasting on the Day of Arafah in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet broke (the fast) of Arafah, Umm Fadl sent him some milk to drink."
question: What is the significance of breaking the fast on the day of Arafah?

hadith-eng: "Ibn Umar was asked about fasting (the Day of) Arafah  (at Arafat). He said: 'I performed Hajj with the Prophet, and he did not fast it, and with Abu Bakr, and he did not fast it, and with Umar, and he did not fast it, and with Uthman, and he did not fast it. I do no fast it, nor order it nor forbid it."
question: What is the significance of fasting on the Day of Arafah according to Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Fast the Day of Ashura, for indeed I anticipate that Allah will forgive (the sins of) the year before it."
question: What is the significance of fasting on the Day of Ashura in Islam?

hadith-eng: "Ashura was a day that the Quraish used to fast during Jahiliyyah, and the Messenger of Allah used to fast it. But when (the fast of) Ramadan became obligatory, the Ramadan was the required and Ashura was left. So whoever wanted to, he fasted it, and whoever wanted to, he left it."
question: What was the significance of fasting on the day of Ashura during the pre-Islamic period?

hadith-eng: "I met up with Ibn Abbas while he was reclining on his Rida at the Zamzam (well). So I said: 'Inform me about the Day of Ashura. On which day is it fasted?' He said: 'When you see the crescent of Al-Muharram, then count, then fast on the morning of the ninth day.'" He said: 'I said: Is this how Muhammad fasted it?' He said: 'Yes.'"
question: What is the significance of fasting on the Day of Ashura in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah ordered fasting the tenth day for the Day of Ashura."
question: What is the significance of fasting on the Day of Ashura in Islam?

hadith-eng: "I did not see the Prophet fasting at all during the ten."
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet's fasting habits during the first ten days of a particular month?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "There are no days in which righteous deeds are more beloved to Allah than those ten days." They said: "O Messenger of Allah! Not even Jihad in Allah Cause?" The Messenger of Allah said: "Not even Jihad in Allah's Cause, unless a man were to out with his self and his wealth and not return from that with anything."
question: What are the most beloved days to Allah for performing righteous deeds?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "There are no days more beloved to Allah that He be worshipped in them than the ten days of Dhul-Hijjah, fasting every day of them is the equivalent of fasting a year, and standing every night of them (in prayer) is the equivalent of standing on the Night of Qadr."
question: What is the significance of the ten days of Dhul-Hijjah in Islamic worship?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever fasts Ramadan, then follows it with six from Shawwal, then that is (equal in reward) to fasting everyday."
question: What is the significance of fasting during the month of Ramadan in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah took a covenant from me for three: To not sleep except after performing Witr, to fast three days of every month, and to perform the Duha prayer."
question: What is the significance of performing the Witr prayer before sleeping?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "O Abu Dharr! When you fast three days out of a month, then fast the thirteenth, fourteenth, and fifteenth."
question: What are the recommended days for fasting in the middle of the lunar month?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah said: 'Whoever fasts three days in every month, then that is (similar to) fasting every day.' Then Allah Mighty and Sublime is He, attested to that in His Book, by revealing: Whoever brings a good deed, shall have ten times the like thereof. So a day is like ten."
question: What is the significance of fasting three days each month in Islam?

hadith-eng: "I heard Mu'adhah saying to Aishah: 'Did the Messenger of Allah fast three days of every month?' She replied in the affirmative. So she said: 'Which of them would he fast?' She said: 'Which of them he would fast was not noticeable.'"
question: Did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) have a specific routine for fasting three days each month?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Indeed your Lord said: 'Every good deed is rewarded with ten of the same up to seven hundred times over. Fasting is for Me, and I shall reward for it.' Fasting is a shield from the Fire. The smell coming from the mouth of the one fasting is more pleasant to Allah than the scent of musk. If one of you is abused by an ignorant person while fasting, then let him say: 'Indeed I am fasting.'"
question: How does fasting serve as a shield from the Fire according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "There is a gate in Paradise called Ar-Raiyyan, those who fast shall be invited into it, and whoever was among those who fasted, then he will enter it; and whoever enters it, he will never thirst again."
question: What is the significance of the gate called Ar-Raiyyan in Paradise?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "There are two joys for the fasting person: the joy when he breaks his fast, and the joy of when he meets his Lord."
question: What are the two types of joy experienced by a fasting person?

hadith-eng: "It was said: 'O Messenger of Allah! What is the case of the one who fasts daily?' He said: 'He did not fast nor break (the fast).'" Or, he said: "He never fasted nor broke (his fast)."
question: What is the significance of moderation in fasting according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "I asked Aishah about the Prophet's fasting.' She said: 'He would fast until we said: "He has fasted" and he would abstain from fasting until we said: "He has abstained from fasting." (She said:) 'The Messenger of Allah did not fast an entire month except Ramadan.'"
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) vary his fasting practices throughout the year?

hadith-eng: Anas bin Malik was asked about the Prophet's fasting and he said: "He would fast during a month until we thought that he did not want to abstain from fasting during any of it. And, he would not fast during a month until we thought that he did not want to fast during any of it. (There was no time) that I wanted to see if he was performing Salat during the night, except that I would see him praying, nor to see him sleeping, except that I would see him sleeping."
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) balance fasting and not fasting during different months?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The most virtuous fast is the fast of my brother Dawud. He would fast a day, and not fast (the next) day. He would not flee at the time of engagement (with the enemy)."
question: What is considered the most virtuous form of fasting in Islam?

hadith-eng: "I witnessed Umar bin Al-Khattab on the Day of Nahr beginning with the Salat before the Khutbah. Then he said: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah prohibit fasting on these two days. As for the Day of Fitr, then it is for you to take a break from your fasting, and a celebration for the Muslims. As for the Day of Adha, then eat from the flesh that you have sacrificed.'"
question: What is the significance of performing Salat before the Khutbah on the Day of Nahr?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah prohibited two fasts: Fasting the Day of Adha and the Day of Fitr."
question: Which two specific days are Muslims prohibited from fasting?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The Day of Arafah, the Day of Nahr, and the Days of Tashriq are Eid for us. The people of Islam, and they are days of eating and drinking,"
question: What are the significant days mentioned as Eid for Muslims in this narration?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The cupper and the one cupped have broke the fast."
question: What is the ruling on cupping during fasting in Islam?

hadith-eng: "the Messenger of Allah was cupped while he was fasting and in Ihram."
question: What is the significance of cupping in Islamic tradition, especially during fasting and Ihram?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet was cupped while he was fasting."
question: What is the ruling on cupping while fasting in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet was cupped somewhere between Makkah and Al-Madinah and he was fasting and in Ihram."
question: What is the significance of cupping in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Do not perform Wisal" They said: "But you perform Wisal O Messenger of Allah." He said: "I am not like you are, indeed my Lord feeds me and gives me to drink."
question: What is the practice of Wisal in fasting and why is it discouraged?

hadith-eng: "Aishah and Umm Salamah, the wives of the Prophet informed me that the Prophet would find that it was Fajr while he was Junub from (relations with) his wives, then he would perform Ghusl and fast."
question: What is the significance of performing Ghusl before starting a fast?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "When one of you is invited to eat then let him respond, if he is fasting then let him pray." Meaning: supplicate.
question: What should a person do when they receive an invitation to eat?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "When one of you is invited (to a meal) and he is fasting, then let him said: 'Indeed I am fasting.'"
question: What should a person do when invited to a meal while fasting?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "A woman may not fast a day - other than in the month of Ramadan - while her husband is present, except with his permission."
question: What is the significance of a husband's permission for a woman to fast outside of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "I would not make up what was due upon me from Ramadan except in Sha'ban, until the Messenger of Allah died."
question: What is the significance of making up missed fasts from Ramadan before the next Ramadan begins?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "When those who are not fasting eat in the presence of the fasting person, the angels send Salat upon him."
question: What is the significance of the angels sending Salat upon a fasting person when others eat in their presence?

hadith-eng: "I heard a freed slave of ours called Laila narrated from [his (Habib's) grandmother] Umm Amarah bint Ka'b Al-Ansar, that the Prophet entered upon her and some food was brought to him. He said: 'Eat.' She said: 'I am fasting.' So the Messenger of Allah said: 'Indeed the angels send Salat upon the fasting person when (others) eat in his presence, until they finish.' And perhaps he said: 'Until they have eaten their fill.'"
question: What is the significance of fasting in the presence of others who are eating?

hadith-eng: From the Prophet, that is similar, except that he did not mention "Until they finish, or they have eating their fill."
question: What is the significance of narrations that have slight variations in wording?

hadith-eng: "We would menstruate during the time of the Messenger of Allah, then when we became pure we were ordered to make up the fasts but we were not ordered to make up the Salat."
question: What is the ruling on making up missed fasts due to menstruation in Islam?

hadith-eng: From his father who said: "I said. 'O Messenger of Allah! Inform me about Wudu.' So he said: "Perform Wudu well, and go between the fingers, and perform Istinshaq extensively except when fasting."
question: What are the key components of performing Wudu correctly?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever stays with a people, then he is not to fast without their permission."
question: What is the significance of seeking permission before fasting when staying with others?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet would perform I'tikaf during the last ten (days) of Ramadan until Allah took him."
question: What is the significance of performing I'tikaf during the last ten days of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah wanted to perform I'tikaf, he would perform Fajr prayer and then he would enter his place of I'tikaf."
question: What is the significance of performing Fajr prayer before starting I'tikaf?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would Yujawir (stay in I'tikaf) during the last ten (nights) of Ramadan and he said: 'Seek the Night of Al-Qadr during the last ten (nights) of Ramadan.'"
question: What is the significance of I'tikaf during the last ten nights of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "I said to Ubayy bin Ka'b: 'O Abu Al-Mundhir! How do you know that it is the night of the twenty-seventh?' He said: 'Rather, the Messenger of Allah informed us that it is a night (after which) the sun rises without rays, so we counted and we remembered it. By Allah! Ibn Mas'ud learned that it is in Ramadan and that it is the nigh of the twenty-seventh, but he did not want to inform you lest you would depend on it."
question: What are the signs of the night of the twenty-seventh of Ramadan according to Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "My father narrated to me: 'The Night of Al-Qadr was mentioned in the presence of Abu Bakrah, so he said: "I do not search for it due to something that I heard from the Messenger of Allah, except for during the last ten (nights); for indeed I heard him say: 'Search for it when nine remain, or; when seven remain, or; when five remain, or; during the last three nights.'" He (Uyainah) said: "During the twenty (nights) of Ramadan, Abu Bakrah used to perform Salat just as he performed Salat during the rest of the year. But when the (last) ten began, he would struggle (performing more Salat during the night)."
question: What is the significance of the last ten nights of Ramadan in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet would awaken his family during the last ten (nights) of Ramadan."
question: What actions did the Prophet take during the last ten nights of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would struggle (to perform Salat more) during the last ten (nights) more than he would struggle in the rest of it."
question: What is the significance of the last ten nights of Ramadan in Islamic practice?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Fasting during the winter is an easy reward."
question: What are the benefits of fasting during the winter season?

hadith-eng: "When the following was revealed: 'And for those upon whom it is difficult, (they may) feed a poor person' - if one of us wanted we would not fast, and pay the ransom, until the Ayah after it was revealed abrogating it."
question: What does the concept of abrogation in Islamic law signify?

hadith-eng: "I went to Anas bin Malik during Ramadan and he was about to travel. His mount was prepared for him, and he put on his traveling clothes, then he called for some food to eat, and I said to him: 'Is it Sunnah?' He said: 'It is Sunnah.' Then he rode."
question: What actions are considered Sunnah when preparing for travel during Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "I went to Anas bin Malik during Ramadan" and he mentioned a similar narration (as no. 799).
question: What is the significance of visiting companions of the Prophet during Ramadan?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The gift for the fasting person is (fragrant) oil and a censer."
question: What are some recommended gifts for a fasting person?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Al-Fitr is the day that the people break the fast, and Al-Adha is the day that the people sacrifice."
question: What determines the day of Eid al-Fitr in the Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet would perform I'tikaf during the last ten (nights) of Ramadan. One year he did not perform I'tikaf, so he performed I'tikaf for twenty (nights) in the following year."
question: What is the significance of performing I'tikaf during the last ten nights of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah performed I'tikaf, he would bring his head near me so I could comb it, and he would not enter the house except for some personal needs."
question: What activities are permissible during I'tikaf according to the practices of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: "We fasted with the Prophet, so he did not pray (the night prayer) with us until seven (nights) of the month remained. Then he (pbuh) led us in prayer until a third of the night had gone, then he did not lead us in prayer on the sixth. Then he led us in prayer on the fifth until half of the night had gone. We said to him: 'O Messenger of Allah! Wouldn't you lead us in prayer for the remainder of the night?' He said: 'Indeed, whoever stands (praying) with the Imam until he finished, then it is recorded for him that he prayed the whole night.; Then he did not lead us in prayer until three (nights) of the month remained. Then he led us in prayer on the third and he called his family and his women to pray with us until we feared missing the Falah" I (Jubair bin Nufair) said to him: "What is the Falah" He said: "The Suhur."
question: What is the significance of praying with the Imam during Ramadan nights?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever provides the food for a fasting person to break his fast with, then for him is the same reward as his (the fasting person's), without anything being diminished from the reward of the fasting person."
question: What is the significance of providing food to a fasting person in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would encourage the  night prayer in Ramadan without firmly ordering it, and he would say: "Whoever stands (in the night prayer) for Ramadan with faith and seeking the reward (from Allah), then he will be forgiven what has preceded of his sins.' So the Messenger of Allah died and the matter was like that. Then the matter was the same during the Khilafah of Abu Bakr and it continued during a portion of the Khilafah of Umar bin Al-Khattab."
question: What is the significance of the night prayer during Ramadan in terms of forgiveness of sins?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "On the first night of the month of Ramadan, the Shayatin are shackled, the jinns are restrained, the gates of the Fires are shut such that no gate among them would be opened. The gates of Paradise are opened such that no gate among them would be closed, and a caller calls: 'O seeker of the good; come near!' and 'O seeker of evil; stop! For there are those whom Allah frees from the Fire.' And that is every night."
question: How are the gates of Paradise and the Fires affected during Ramadan?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever fasts Ramadan and stands (in the night prayer) for it out of faith and seeking a reward (from Allah), he will be forgiven what preceded of his sins. Whoever stands (in the night prayer) on the Night of Al-Qadr out of faith and seeking a reward (from Allah), he will be forgiven what preceded of his sins."
question: How does standing in night prayer during Ramadan contribute to forgiveness of sins?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Do not precede the month with a day nor with two days, unless that fast falls on a day that one of you would have (normally) fasted. Fast with its sighting and break fast with its sighting, and if it is cloudy, then count for thirty days, and then break (the fast)."
question: How should one determine the beginning and end of the fasting month according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Do no precede the month of Ramadan by fasting a day or two before it, unless it is the case of a man who normally performs some fast, then let him fast it."
question: Are there any exceptions to fasting a day or two before Ramadan begins?

hadith-eng: "We were with Ammar bin Yasir when a roasted sheep was brought and he said: 'Eat.' Someone among the people said: 'I am fasting.' So Ammar said: 'Whoever fasts on a day in which there is doubt, then he has disobeyed Abul-Qasim (pbuh)."
question: How does Ammar bin Yasir's statement reflect the importance of certainty in religious observances?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Count the (the appearances of) the crescent of Sha'ban for Ramadan."
question: How does the sighting of the crescent moon affect the determination of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Do not fast before Ramadan. Fast with its sighting, and break fast with its sighting, and if it is obscured from you, then complete thirty days."
question: Why is it advised not to fast before the month of Ramadan begins?

hadith-eng:
"What I fasted with the Prophet that was twenty-nine (days), was more than what we fasted that was thirty."
(He said): There are narrations on this topic from `Umar, Abu Hurairah, `A'isha, Sa`d bin Abi Waqqas, Ibn `Abbas, Ibn `Umar, Anas, Jabir, Umm Salamah, Abu Bakrah, that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The month is twenty nine (days)."
question: How does the variation in the number of days in a month affect the observance of fasting in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah vowed to stay away from his wives for a month, so he stayed in a loft for twenty-nine days. They said: 'O Messenger of Allah, your vow was for a month,' so he said: 'The month is twenty-nine (days).'"
question: How does the Islamic calendar define the length of a month?

hadith-eng: "A Bedouin came to the Prophet and said: 'I have seen the crescent.' So he said: 'Do you testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah? Do you testify that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'Yes.' So he said: 'O Bilal! Announce to the people that they should fast tomorrow.'"
question: How does the testimony of faith play a role in Islamic practices and rituals?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "The two months of Eid will not both be deficient: Ramadn and Dhul-Hijjah."
question: Why are the months of Ramadan and Dhul-Hijjah considered important in the Islamic calendar?

hadith-eng: "Kuraib informed me that Umm Al-Fadl bin Al-Harith sent him to Mu'awiyah in Ash-Sham. He said: 'So I arrived in Ash-Sham and finished her errand, and I saw the crescent of Ramadan while I was in Ash-Sham. We saw the crescent on the night of Friday. Then I arrived in Al-Madinah at the end of the month. Ibn Abbas was questioning me, then he mentioned the crescent and he said: "When did you see the crescent?" I said: "We saw it n the night of Friday." He said: "Did you see it on the night of Friday?" I said: "The people saw it, so they fasted, and Mu'awiyah fasted." He said: "But we saw it on the night of Saturday, so we will not stop fasting until we complete thirty days or we see it." So I said: "Is not the sighting and fasting of Mu'awiyah enough for you?" He said: "This is not how the Messenger of Allah ordered us."
question: How did Ibn Abbas respond to the moon sighting reported from Ash-Sham?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever has dried dates, then let him break the fast with that, and whoever does not, then let him break the fast with water, for indeed water is purifying."
question: Why are dried dates considered significant for breaking the fast?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "When one of you breaks his fast, then let him do so with dried dates. And whoever does not find dates, then water, for it is purifying."
question: What should a person do if they cannot find dates to break their fast?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would break the fast with fresh dates before performing Salat. If there were no fresh dates then (he would break the fast) with dried dates, and if there were no dried dates then he would take a few sips of water."
question: What alternatives are suggested if fresh dates are not available for breaking the fast?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "The fast is the day the people fast, the breaking of the fast is the day the people break their fast, and the sacrifice is the day the people sacrifice."
question: How does the timing of religious practices like fasting and sacrifice relate to the community's actions?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "When the night advances and the day retreats, and the sun is hidden, then the fast is to be broken."
question: How does the position of the sun relate to the timing of breaking the fast?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "The people will remain upon goodness as long as they hasten to break the fast."
question: How does the timing of breaking the fast relate to the concept of goodness in the community?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Allah, Mighty and Sublime is He, said: 'Those of My worshippers who are most beloved to me are the quickest to break their fast.'"
question: What is the significance of breaking the fast quickly in Islam?

hadith-eng: (A Hadith similar to no. 700 with a different chain).
question: How does the chain of narration affect the authenticity of a hadith?

hadith-eng: "Masruq and I entered upon Aishah and we said: 'O Mother of the Believers! There are two men from the Companions of Muhammad, one of them hastens to break the fasts and he hastens to perform Salat. The other delays breaking the fast and he delays the Salat.' She said: 'Which of them hastens to break the fast and hastens to perform the Salat?' We said that it was Abdullah bin Mas'ud. She said: 'This is how the Messenger of Allah did it.' And the other was Abu Musa."
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) approach the timing of breaking the fast and performing Salat?

hadith-eng: Zaid bin Thabit said: "We ate Sahar with the Messenger of Allah, then we stood for the Salat." I (Anas) said: "How long was that?" He said: "About the lengthy of fifty Ayahs."
question: How does the timing of the pre-dawn meal relate to the timing of the Fajr prayer?

hadith-eng: (Another chain) except that he said: "About the length for reciting fifty Ayahs."
question: How does the recitation of a specific number of Ayahs relate to the performance of certain religious duties?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Eat and drink, and do not be disturbed by the rising glow, eat and drink until the redness appears to you on the horizon."
question: How does the appearance of redness on the horizon relate to the fasting schedule?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Do not let the Adhan of Bilal prevent you from your Sahar, nor the drawn out Fajr, but the Fajr that spreads on the horizon."
question: How can one distinguish between the drawn out Fajr and the Fajr that spreads on the horizon?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Whoever does not leave false speech, and acting according to it, then Allah is not in any need of him leaving his food and his drink."
question: How does engaging in false speech affect the spiritual benefits of fasting?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Partake of Sahar, for indeed there is a blessing in the Sahar."
question: How is the concept of blessing associated with the pre-dawn meal in Islam?

hadith-eng: (similar to no. 708) from the Prophet.
question: How does the repetition of a hadith in different narrations affect its understanding and interpretation?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah went to Makkah in the Year of the Conquest, so he fasted until he reached Kura Al-Ghamim and the people were fasting with him. Then it was said to him: 'The fast has become difficult for the people, and they are watching you to see what you will do.' So after Asr, he called for a cup of water and drank it while the people were looking at him. Some of them broke the fast while some of them continued their fasting. It was conveyed to him that people were still fasting, so he said: "Those are the disobedient.'"
question: How did the Prophet demonstrate leadership and consideration for his followers during the journey to Makkah?

hadith-eng: Hamzah bin Amr Al-Aslami asked the Messenger of Allah about fasting while traveling, and he fasted regularly. So the Messenger of Allah said: 'If you wish then fast, and if you wish then break (the fast).'"
question: How does Islam provide flexibility in religious obligations during travel?

hadith-eng: "We were on a journey with the Messenger of Allah during the month of Ramadan. No one objected to the fast of the one fasting nor the fast breaking of the one who broke his fast."
question: How does this narration illustrate the flexibility of fasting rules during travel in Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "We were on a journey with the Messenger of Allah. Some of us were fasting and some of us broke their fast. The one who broke their fast had no objection to the one who fasted, and the one who fasted had no objection to the one who broke his fast. They saw that whoever had the strength to fast then that was good, and whoever was weak, then breaking it was better."
question: How does this narration illustrate the flexibility in Islamic rulings concerning fasting while traveling?

hadith-eng: he asked Ibn Al-Musaiyab about fasting on a journey, so he narrated to him that Umar bin Al-Khattab said: "We fought in two battles along with the Messenger of Allah during Ramadan; the Day of Badr, and the Conquest (of Makkah), so we broke our fast during them."
question: How did the companions of the Prophet handle fasting during significant battles?

hadith-eng: "Some cavalry man of the Messenger of Allah came galloping upon us, so I came to the Messenger of Allah and found him having lunch. He said: "Come and eat." I said: 'I am fasting.' So he said: 'Come and I will narrate to you about the fast - or fasting. Indeed Allah Most High lifted (the fast and) half of the Salat from the traveler, and (He lifted) the fast - or fasting - from the pregnant person, or the breast-feeding person.' And by Allah! The Prophet said both of them or one of them. So woe to me! For I did not eat from the meal of the Prophet."
question: How does the hadith address the concept of flexibility in religious obligations for certain individuals?

hadith-eng: "A woman came to the Prophet and said: 'My sister died while she had two consecutive months of fasting due.' So he said: 'Do you not see that if there was a debt due from your sister then you would have to pay it?' She said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Then the right of Allah is more appropriate.'"
question: How does the concept of debt relate to religious duties in Islam?

hadith-eng: (A Hadith similar to no. 716 with a different chain.)
question: How does the variation in chains of narration affect the authenticity of a hadith?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Whoever died while he had a month to fast, then a needy person should be fed on his behalf in place of every day."
question: How can the obligation of missed fasts be fulfilled on behalf of a deceased person?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Three things do not break the fast of the fasting person: Cupping, vomiting, and the wet dream."
question: How does Islamic jurisprudence view the impact of cupping on fasting?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Whoever is overcome by vomiting, then he is not required to make up (the fast), and whoever vomits on purpose, then he must make it up."
question: What should a person do if they induce vomiting while fasting?

hadith-eng: "Whoever eats or drinks forgetfully, then he has not broken (the fast), for it was only a provision that Allah provided for him."
question: How does Islam view unintentional actions during fasting?

hadith-eng: (Another chain) with the same or similar (Hadith as no. 721).
question: What is the importance of verifying the chain of narration in hadith literature?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever breaks the fast during Ramadan without an allowance or illness, then if he fasted for all time, his fasting would not make up for it."
question: How significant is it to maintain the fast during Ramadan according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: A man came and said: "O Messenger of Allah; I am ruined!" He said: "What has ruined you?" He said: "I had sexual relations with my wife during Ramadan." He said: "Are you able to free a slave?" He said, "No." He said: "Then are you able to fast for two consecutive months?" He said, "No." He said: "Then are you able to feed sixty needy people?" He said, "No." He said: "Sit." So he sat. A big basket full of dates was brought to the Prophet, and he said: "Give it in charity." So he said: "There is no one needier than us between its two mountains." So the Prophet laughing until his pre-molar teeth appeared, and he said: "Then take it to feed your family."
question: What are the options for expiation if someone breaks their fast by having sexual relations during Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "I saw the Prophet - (a number of times) such that I was not able to count - using the Siwak while he was fasting."
question: How frequently did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) use the Siwak while fasting according to this narration?

hadith-eng: a man came to the Prophet and said: "My eyes are bothering me, can I use Kuhl while I am fasting?" He said: "Yes."
question: What guidance did the Prophet provide regarding the use of Kuhl during fasting?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet would kiss during the month of fasting."
question: How does the act of kissing relate to the observance of fasting in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would fondle me while he was fasting, and he had the most control among you of his limb (li irbihi)."
question: How does this narration illustrate the balance between marital affection and religious observance?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would kiss and fondle while he was fasting, and he had the most control among you of his limbs."
question: How does self-control relate to fasting in Islam?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Whoever did not decide to fast before Fajr then there is no fast for him."
question: How does the timing of making an intention affect the validity of a fast?

hadith-eng: "I was sitting with the Prophet when some drink was brought, so he drank from it, then he offered it to me and I drank it. Then I said: 'I have indeed sinned, so seek forgiveness for me.' He said: 'What is that?' I said: 'I was fasting, then I broke the fast.' He said: 'Were you performing a fast that you had to make up?' I said: 'No.' He said: 'Then it is no harm for you.'"
question: How does the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) respond to someone who unintentionally breaks a fast?

hadith-eng: "A person from the offspring of Umm Hani narrated to me - I met one of the most virtuous among them, and his name was Ja'dah, and Umm Hani was his grandmother - he narrated to me from his grandmother that the Messenger of Allah entered upon her and asked for some drink, and he drank. Then he offered it to her and she drank it. Then she said: "O Messenger of Allah! I was fasting." So the Messenger of Allah said: "The one fasting a voluntary fast is the trustee for himself; if he wishes he fasts, and if he wishes he breaks." Shu'bah (one of the narrators) said: "I said to him (Ja'dah), 'Did you hear this from Umm Hani?' He said: 'No Abu Salih and our family informed us of it from Umm Hani.'"
question: How does the concept of personal discretion apply to voluntary fasting?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah visited me one day and said: 'Do you have anything (to eat)?'" She said: "I said: 'No.' He said: 'Then I am fasting.'"
question: How does the Prophet (ﷺ) demonstrate flexibility in his daily routine regarding fasting?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah came to me saying, 'Do you have anything for breakfast?' I said: 'No.' Then he said: 'I am fasting.'" She said: "One day he came to me and I said: 'O Messenger of Allah; I have received a gift for us.' He said: 'What is it?'" She said: "I said 'Hais'  He said: 'I began the day fasting'" She said: "Then he ate."
question: How does the concept of intention affect the observance of fasting in Islam?

hadith-eng: "Hafsah and I were both fasting when we were presented some food that we really wanted, so we ate from it. The Messenger of Allah came, and Hafsah beat me to him - she was the daughter of her father - and she said: 'O Messenger of Allah! We were both fasting when we were presented with some food that we wanted, so we ate from it.' He said: 'Make up another day in its place.'"
question: How does the concept of making up a missed fast reflect on the principles of accountability in Islam?

hadith-eng: "I did not see the Prophet fasting two consecutive months except for Sha'ban and Ramadan."
question: How often did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) fast consecutively, according to the narration?

hadith-eng: from the Prophet.
question: How does the chain of narration impact the authenticity of a hadith?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "When a half of Sha'ban remains then do not fast."
question: Why might fasting be discouraged during the latter half of Sha'ban?

hadith-eng: "I could not find the Messenger of Allah one night. So I left and found him at Al-Baqi. He said: 'Did you fear that you had been wronged by Allah and His Messenger?' I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I thought that you had gone to one of your wives.' So he said: 'Indeed Allah, Mighty and Sublime is He, descends to the lowest Heavens during the night of the middle of Sha'ban, to grant forgiveness to more than the number of hairs on the sheep of (Banu) Kalb.'"
question: How does Allah's forgiveness manifest during the night of the middle of Sha'ban?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "The most virtuous fasting after the month of Ramadan is Allah's month Al-Muharram."
question: What significance does the month of Al-Muharram hold in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "A man asked Ali: "Which month do you order me to fast after the month of Ramadan?' He said to him, 'I have not heard anyone ask this except for a man whom I heard asking the Messenger of Allah while I was sitting with him. He said: "O Messenger of Allah! Which month do you order me to fast after the month of Ramadan?" He said: "If you will fast after the month of Ramadan, then fast Al-Muharram, for indeed it is Allah's month in which there is a day that Allah accepted the repentance of a people, and in which He accepts the repentance of other people."
question: What significance does the month of Al-Muharram hold in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would fasting during the beginning of every month for three days, and Friday was the least of the days that he did not fast."
question: How often did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) fast during the beginning of the month?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "None of you should fast on Friday unless he fasts before it, or he fasts after it."
question: Why is it recommended to fast on days before or after Friday?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Do not fast on Saturday except for what has been made obligatory upon you (by Allah). If one of you does not find but a grape peal or a tree's twig, then let him chew it."
question: Under what circumstances is fasting on Saturday permissible?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet used to try to fast on Mondays and Thursdays."
question: What is the significance of fasting on specific days in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would fast Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays in one months, and Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays in the next month."
question: How did the fasting schedule of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) vary between different months?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Deeds are presented on Monday and Thursday, and I love that my deeds be presented while I am fasting."
question: What is the significance of fasting on specific days in Islam?

hadith-eng: "I asked - or; the Prophet was asked - about fasting daily. So he said: 'Your family has a right over you.' Then he said: 'Fast Ramadan and that which is after it, and every Wednesday and Thursday. If you do that, then you will have fasted daily, as well as broken (the fast).'"
question: How can one achieve the reward of fasting daily while still observing breaks?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Fast the Day of Arafah, for indeed I anticipate that Allah will forgive (the sins) of the year after it, and the year before it."
question: How does fasting on the Day of Arafah impact the forgiveness of sins?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet broke (the fast) of Arafah, Umm Fadl sent him some milk to drink."
question: How did the Prophet respond to receiving milk from Umm Fadl on the day of Arafah?

hadith-eng: "Ibn Umar was asked about fasting (the Day of) Arafah  (at Arafat). He said: 'I performed Hajj with the Prophet, and he did not fast it, and with Abu Bakr, and he did not fast it, and with Umar, and he did not fast it, and with Uthman, and he did not fast it. I do no fast it, nor order it nor forbid it."
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad and his companions approach fasting on the Day of Arafah during Hajj?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Fast the Day of Ashura, for indeed I anticipate that Allah will forgive (the sins of) the year before it."
question: How does fasting on Ashura relate to the forgiveness of sins?

hadith-eng: "Ashura was a day that the Quraish used to fast during Jahiliyyah, and the Messenger of Allah used to fast it. But when (the fast of) Ramadan became obligatory, the Ramadan was the required and Ashura was left. So whoever wanted to, he fasted it, and whoever wanted to, he left it."
question: How did the obligation of fasting change with the introduction of Ramadan in Islam?

hadith-eng: "I met up with Ibn Abbas while he was reclining on his Rida at the Zamzam (well). So I said: 'Inform me about the Day of Ashura. On which day is it fasted?' He said: 'When you see the crescent of Al-Muharram, then count, then fast on the morning of the ninth day.'" He said: 'I said: Is this how Muhammad fasted it?' He said: 'Yes.'"
question: How is the date for fasting on Ashura determined according to Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah ordered fasting the tenth day for the Day of Ashura."
question: Which day is recommended for fasting according to Islamic tradition related to Ashura?

hadith-eng: "I did not see the Prophet fasting at all during the ten."
question: How does the practice of fasting vary among different periods in the Islamic calendar?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "There are no days in which righteous deeds are more beloved to Allah than those ten days." They said: "O Messenger of Allah! Not even Jihad in Allah Cause?" The Messenger of Allah said: "Not even Jihad in Allah's Cause, unless a man were to out with his self and his wealth and not return from that with anything."
question: How do the ten days mentioned compare to Jihad in terms of their significance in Islam?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "There are no days more beloved to Allah that He be worshipped in them than the ten days of Dhul-Hijjah, fasting every day of them is the equivalent of fasting a year, and standing every night of them (in prayer) is the equivalent of standing on the Night of Qadr."
question: How does fasting during the ten days of Dhul-Hijjah compare to fasting for an entire year?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever fasts Ramadan, then follows it with six from Shawwal, then that is (equal in reward) to fasting everyday."
question: How does fasting in the month of Shawwal complement the fasting of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah took a covenant from me for three: To not sleep except after performing Witr, to fast three days of every month, and to perform the Duha prayer."
question: Why is fasting three days of every month recommended in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "O Abu Dharr! When you fast three days out of a month, then fast the thirteenth, fourteenth, and fifteenth."
question: Why might fasting on specific days of the month be significant in Islamic practice?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah said: 'Whoever fasts three days in every month, then that is (similar to) fasting every day.' Then Allah Mighty and Sublime is He, attested to that in His Book, by revealing: Whoever brings a good deed, shall have ten times the like thereof. So a day is like ten."
question: How does fasting three days a month equate to fasting every day according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "I heard Mu'adhah saying to Aishah: 'Did the Messenger of Allah fast three days of every month?' She replied in the affirmative. So she said: 'Which of them would he fast?' She said: 'Which of them he would fast was not noticeable.'"
question: How did Aishah describe the Prophet's practice of fasting three days a month?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Indeed your Lord said: 'Every good deed is rewarded with ten of the same up to seven hundred times over. Fasting is for Me, and I shall reward for it.' Fasting is a shield from the Fire. The smell coming from the mouth of the one fasting is more pleasant to Allah than the scent of musk. If one of you is abused by an ignorant person while fasting, then let him say: 'Indeed I am fasting.'"
question: What is the significance of the reward for good deeds in Islam, and how does it relate to fasting?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "There is a gate in Paradise called Ar-Raiyyan, those who fast shall be invited into it, and whoever was among those who fasted, then he will enter it; and whoever enters it, he will never thirst again."
question: Who will be invited to enter through the gate of Ar-Raiyyan?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "There are two joys for the fasting person: the joy when he breaks his fast, and the joy of when he meets his Lord."
question: How does breaking the fast bring joy to a fasting person?

hadith-eng: "It was said: 'O Messenger of Allah! What is the case of the one who fasts daily?' He said: 'He did not fast nor break (the fast).'" Or, he said: "He never fasted nor broke (his fast)."
question: How does fasting every day affect the spiritual and physical aspects of a Muslim's life?

hadith-eng: "I asked Aishah about the Prophet's fasting.' She said: 'He would fast until we said: "He has fasted" and he would abstain from fasting until we said: "He has abstained from fasting." (She said:) 'The Messenger of Allah did not fast an entire month except Ramadan.'"
question: What was the only month in which the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) fasted for the entire duration?

hadith-eng: Anas bin Malik was asked about the Prophet's fasting and he said: "He would fast during a month until we thought that he did not want to abstain from fasting during any of it. And, he would not fast during a month until we thought that he did not want to fast during any of it. (There was no time) that I wanted to see if he was performing Salat during the night, except that I would see him praying, nor to see him sleeping, except that I would see him sleeping."
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) night prayers from Anas bin Malik's observation?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The most virtuous fast is the fast of my brother Dawud. He would fast a day, and not fast (the next) day. He would not flee at the time of engagement (with the enemy)."
question: How did Prophet Dawud practice fasting according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "I witnessed Umar bin Al-Khattab on the Day of Nahr beginning with the Salat before the Khutbah. Then he said: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah prohibit fasting on these two days. As for the Day of Fitr, then it is for you to take a break from your fasting, and a celebration for the Muslims. As for the Day of Adha, then eat from the flesh that you have sacrificed.'"
question: Why is fasting prohibited on the Day of Fitr and the Day of Adha?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah prohibited two fasts: Fasting the Day of Adha and the Day of Fitr."
question: What is the significance of the Day of Adha in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The Day of Arafah, the Day of Nahr, and the Days of Tashriq are Eid for us. The people of Islam, and they are days of eating and drinking,"
question: What activities are encouraged during the Days of Tashriq according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The cupper and the one cupped have broke the fast."
question: How does cupping affect the validity of a fast?

hadith-eng: "the Messenger of Allah was cupped while he was fasting and in Ihram."
question: How does the practice of cupping relate to the observance of fasting in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet was cupped while he was fasting."
question: How does the practice of cupping relate to the observance of fasting?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet was cupped somewhere between Makkah and Al-Madinah and he was fasting and in Ihram."
question: How does fasting affect the permissibility of medical treatments like cupping?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Do not perform Wisal" They said: "But you perform Wisal O Messenger of Allah." He said: "I am not like you are, indeed my Lord feeds me and gives me to drink."
question: How does the Prophet Muhammad's ability to perform Wisal differ from that of his followers?

hadith-eng: "Aishah and Umm Salamah, the wives of the Prophet informed me that the Prophet would find that it was Fajr while he was Junub from (relations with) his wives, then he would perform Ghusl and fast."
question: How does the state of being Junub affect the validity of fasting?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "When one of you is invited to eat then let him respond, if he is fasting then let him pray." Meaning: supplicate.
question: How should a fasting person respond to an invitation to eat?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "When one of you is invited (to a meal) and he is fasting, then let him said: 'Indeed I am fasting.'"
question: How should one communicate their fasting status when invited to eat?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "A woman may not fast a day - other than in the month of Ramadan - while her husband is present, except with his permission."
question: How does the presence of a husband affect a woman's voluntary fasting?

hadith-eng: "I would not make up what was due upon me from Ramadan except in Sha'ban, until the Messenger of Allah died."
question: How did Aishah manage her missed fasts from Ramadan according to her narration?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "When those who are not fasting eat in the presence of the fasting person, the angels send Salat upon him."
question: How does the presence of non-fasting individuals affect the spiritual state of a fasting person?

hadith-eng: "I heard a freed slave of ours called Laila narrated from [his (Habib's) grandmother] Umm Amarah bint Ka'b Al-Ansar, that the Prophet entered upon her and some food was brought to him. He said: 'Eat.' She said: 'I am fasting.' So the Messenger of Allah said: 'Indeed the angels send Salat upon the fasting person when (others) eat in his presence, until they finish.' And perhaps he said: 'Until they have eaten their fill.'"
question: How do the angels interact with a fasting person when others are eating around them?

hadith-eng: From the Prophet, that is similar, except that he did not mention "Until they finish, or they have eating their fill."
question: How do different chains of narration affect the understanding of a hadith?

hadith-eng: "We would menstruate during the time of the Messenger of Allah, then when we became pure we were ordered to make up the fasts but we were not ordered to make up the Salat."
question: Why are women not required to make up missed prayers during menstruation?

hadith-eng: From his father who said: "I said. 'O Messenger of Allah! Inform me about Wudu.' So he said: "Perform Wudu well, and go between the fingers, and perform Istinshaq extensively except when fasting."
question: Why is it important to clean between the fingers during Wudu?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever stays with a people, then he is not to fast without their permission."
question: How does the concept of communal harmony relate to individual acts of worship like fasting?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet would perform I'tikaf during the last ten (days) of Ramadan until Allah took him."
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) observe the last ten days of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah wanted to perform I'tikaf, he would perform Fajr prayer and then he would enter his place of I'tikaf."
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) prepare for I'tikaf?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would Yujawir (stay in I'tikaf) during the last ten (nights) of Ramadan and he said: 'Seek the Night of Al-Qadr during the last ten (nights) of Ramadan.'"
question: Why is the Night of Al-Qadr considered important in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "I said to Ubayy bin Ka'b: 'O Abu Al-Mundhir! How do you know that it is the night of the twenty-seventh?' He said: 'Rather, the Messenger of Allah informed us that it is a night (after which) the sun rises without rays, so we counted and we remembered it. By Allah! Ibn Mas'ud learned that it is in Ramadan and that it is the nigh of the twenty-seventh, but he did not want to inform you lest you would depend on it."
question: Why might some companions choose not to disclose the exact night of Laylat al-Qadr?

hadith-eng: "My father narrated to me: 'The Night of Al-Qadr was mentioned in the presence of Abu Bakrah, so he said: "I do not search for it due to something that I heard from the Messenger of Allah, except for during the last ten (nights); for indeed I heard him say: 'Search for it when nine remain, or; when seven remain, or; when five remain, or; during the last three nights.'" He (Uyainah) said: "During the twenty (nights) of Ramadan, Abu Bakrah used to perform Salat just as he performed Salat during the rest of the year. But when the (last) ten began, he would struggle (performing more Salat during the night)."
question: How did Abu Bakrah's prayer routine change during the last ten nights of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet would awaken his family during the last ten (nights) of Ramadan."
question: How did the Prophet involve his family in the practices of the last ten nights of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would struggle (to perform Salat more) during the last ten (nights) more than he would struggle in the rest of it."
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad increase his efforts in worship during the last ten nights of Ramadan?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Fasting during the winter is an easy reward."
question: Why is fasting considered easier during the winter months?

hadith-eng: "When the following was revealed: 'And for those upon whom it is difficult, (they may) feed a poor person' - if one of us wanted we would not fast, and pay the ransom, until the Ayah after it was revealed abrogating it."
question: How did the early Muslims respond to the revelation of new Quranic verses?

hadith-eng: "I went to Anas bin Malik during Ramadan and he was about to travel. His mount was prepared for him, and he put on his traveling clothes, then he called for some food to eat, and I said to him: 'Is it Sunnah?' He said: 'It is Sunnah.' Then he rode."
question: How did Anas bin Malik demonstrate the practice of Sunnah before traveling?

hadith-eng: "I went to Anas bin Malik during Ramadan" and he mentioned a similar narration (as no. 799).
question: How can the practices of the companions during Ramadan serve as a model for Muslims today?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The gift for the fasting person is (fragrant) oil and a censer."
question: How can fragrant oil and a censer be significant for someone who is fasting?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Al-Fitr is the day that the people break the fast, and Al-Adha is the day that the people sacrifice."
question: How is the day of Eid al-Adha identified according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet would perform I'tikaf during the last ten (nights) of Ramadan. One year he did not perform I'tikaf, so he performed I'tikaf for twenty (nights) in the following year."
question: How did the Prophet compensate for missing I'tikaf in one year?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah performed I'tikaf, he would bring his head near me so I could comb it, and he would not enter the house except for some personal needs."
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) maintain personal grooming during I'tikaf?

hadith-eng: "We fasted with the Prophet, so he did not pray (the night prayer) with us until seven (nights) of the month remained. Then he (pbuh) led us in prayer until a third of the night had gone, then he did not lead us in prayer on the sixth. Then he led us in prayer on the fifth until half of the night had gone. We said to him: 'O Messenger of Allah! Wouldn't you lead us in prayer for the remainder of the night?' He said: 'Indeed, whoever stands (praying) with the Imam until he finished, then it is recorded for him that he prayed the whole night.; Then he did not lead us in prayer until three (nights) of the month remained. Then he led us in prayer on the third and he called his family and his women to pray with us until we feared missing the Falah" I (Jubair bin Nufair) said to him: "What is the Falah" He said: "The Suhur."
question: How does praying with the Imam affect the reward of praying the entire night?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever provides the food for a fasting person to break his fast with, then for him is the same reward as his (the fasting person's), without anything being diminished from the reward of the fasting person."
question: How does sharing in the reward of a fasting person benefit the provider of food?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would encourage the  night prayer in Ramadan without firmly ordering it, and he would say: "Whoever stands (in the night prayer) for Ramadan with faith and seeking the reward (from Allah), then he will be forgiven what has preceded of his sins.'
